noun.description: A bird or other animal which cheeps; especially a young partridge or grouse.
Scottish and English regional (northern). The meadow pipit, Anthus pratensis, which has a plaintive call. Usually with distinguishing word. Now rare.
Scottish informal. A kiss, especially a light one; a peck.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Randle Cotgrave (fl. 1587–?1630), lexicographer. From cheep + -er.
